subject: junit.contrib and releases

Hi JUnit,

I am just about ready to release a version of the JUnit theories=
 runner in junit.contrib (https://github.com/junit-team/junit.contrib) that=
 is current with the core implementation in 4.11, and supports generics in =
theory parameter types to address this issue: https://github.com/junit-team=
/junit/issues/64 .

Snapshots of this and my extension that really wants it=
, junit-quickcheck (https://github.com/pholser/junit-quickcheck) are curren=
tly on the Sonatype Maven repo: https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositori=
es/snapshots/ . I also have a pull request open against junit.contrib to br=
ing in some POM machinery to enable releases of the contrib'd theories runn=
er: https://github.com/junit-team/junit.contrib/pull/15

Before someone mer=
ges the pull req, though, I'd like to talk about what to do for releasing t=
he different contributions to junit.contrib.

My feeling is that it would b=
e best to allow each of the contributions to be built/released/versioned in=
dependently. To that end, I'm thinking it would be best to have each of the=
 "modules" in contrib split out into separate repos on GitHub, as Git subtr=
ees (http://blogs.atlassian.com/2013/05/alternatives-to-git-submodule-git-s=
ubtree/) -- not to be confused with "submodules".

I have an issue opened o=
n GitHub for further discussion -- https://github.com/junit-team/junit.cont=
rib/issues/16 . I'd appreciate anyone's input on this, especially those of =
committers. 8^)

Cheers,
Paul Holser
